facts: Jaipur is also known as Paris of India
Jaipur is considered the first planned city in India, built according to the principles of Vastu-Shastra, an ancient Indian system of architecture
Jaipur was recognized at the UNESCO world heritage site in 2019
Jaipur is a part of popular golden triangle tourist circuit along with Delhi and Agra
Jodhpur's iconic blue color is a result of the traditional practices of painting houses particularly those of Brahmins, in blue to distinguish them from others
Umeed Bhawan Palace in Jodhpur is one of the largest private residences in the world it is still Home to the royal family of Jodhpur
Jodhpur is also known as Sun City due to its abundance of sunshine and bright days throughout the year
Jodhpur is famous for the rare Marwari or Malani breed of horses which are only found there
Udaipur is also known as “Venice of the east”
Udaipur is also known as “city of the lakes”
Udaipur is famous for its interconnected lakes, including lake Pichola, Fateh Sagar lake and Jaisamand lake
The Kumbhalgarh food Udaipur has the second-longest wall in the world after the Great Wall of China
Jaisalmer fort built by Rawal Jaisal is a UNESCO world Heritage site and one of the few living forts in the world
Jaisalmer is famous for its beautiful sandstone building that seem to shine in the sun, earning in the nickname “Golden city”
Jaisalmer is located in the Thar desert and is known for its sand dunes, camel rides, and desert Safari
In Jaisamer Sam Sand Dunes, a popular tourist spot offer camel rides, Jeep safaris, and views of sunset
Pushkar has one and only Brahma Temple in the world
Pushkar has the lake considered secret and has 52 ghats where pilgrims bathe
The Pushkar camel fair is one of the largest livestock fairs in the world, attracting both livestock traders and tourists
Pushkar is also known as the “rose garden” of Rajasthan and is a major center for cultivation
Bikaner is a desert oasis renowned for camel breeding and dry irrigation techniques
Bikaner has the temple called KARNI MATA TEMPLE also considered as “Rats Temple”
Bikaner has Lalgarh Palace built in the early 20th century, is a blend of European and Rajput architecture and is now a luxury hotel
Mandawa is a small town in Rajasthan, India, known as an "open-air art gallery" for its beautifully painted havelis (mansions)
Mandawa architecture reflects a fusion of Rajasthani, Mughal, and even European influences, showcasing its diverse cultural past
The best time to visit Mandawa during the winter months from October to March
Bundi is nicknamed The “city of stepwells” is due to its numerous and intricate stepwells, some of which date back centuries
Bundi is also known as "Chhoti Kashi," which translates to "small Varanasi," highlighting its cultural and spiritual significance
Bundi features the 84-Pillared Cenotaph (Chaurasi Khambon Ki Chhatri), a majestic structure with 84 columns, showcasing intricate carvings of deer, elephants, and apsaras
Bundi is famous for its Rajput-style paintings, particularly the famous Ragmala series
Mount Abu is a popular destination for both spiritual seekers and adventure enthusiasts
Mount Abu Guru Shikhar, the highest peak in the Aravalli Range, is located in Mount Abu
Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary is home to diverse flora and fauna, including leopards and sloth bear
